availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert A. Thomas (Montgomery County, KY, soldier)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, soldier. Montgomery County native. Son of Robert Thomas and Mary Thomas. Married to Catherine "Kate" D. Hainline Thomas on October 22, 1858. Father of Georgia A. Thomas and John S. Thomas. Student in Montgomery County in 1850. Household owned twenty enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1850. Served in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant from August 21, 1862 to September 16, 1863. Served in the 73rd Regiment Kentucky Enrolled Militia as lieutenant colonel in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 2, p. 82A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 2, p. 59 (p. 7 of microfilm).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Montgomery County Marriages, Film # 000216835, p. 1
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 132.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Missouri, Dekalb County, Grand River Township, p.303C.
Historical Register of National Homes for Disabled Volunteer Soldiers, 1866-1938, NARA Microfilm Publication M1749, Records of the Department of Veterans Affairs, RG 15, Leavenworth (accessed through ancestry.com on September 19, 2019), p. 278 of microfilm.
Find A Grave, "Robert A. Thomas (1834-1920)," Memorial #73617602, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/73617602 (accessed September 19, 2019).
